intro: Donnellsmithia breedlovei, commonly known as the Texas milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in Texas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Donnellsmithia breedlovei is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
